node.title: Latest: Biden 'confident we're on the right track' after US records 1.1m COVID cases in a day
node.content: ["Here's the latest on the COVID-19 pandemic from around the world.\n", "President Joe Biden and top health officials on Tuesday defended the administration's response to the unrelenting pandemic as daily US COVID-19 cases reached a new high, largely fuelled by the highly contagious Omicron variant.", "Biden, who has been accused of focussing on vaccinations at the expense of testing and support for struggling healthcare systems, told reporters on Tuesday he was \"confident we're on the right track\" to fight the pandemic.", "The US reported 1.35 million new coronavirus infections on Monday, according to a Reuters tally, the highest daily total for any country in the world the highly contagious Omicron variant showed no signs of slowing. The previous record was 1.03 million cases on January 3.\u00a0", "A large number of cases are reported each Monday due to many states not reporting at the weekend. The seven-day average for new cases has tripled in two weeks to over 700,000 new infections a day.", "The Omicron variant of COVID-19 is on track to infect more than half of Europeans, but it should not yet be seen as a flu-like endemic illness, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Tuesday.", "Europe saw more than 7 million newly-reported cases in the first week of 2022, more than doubling over a two-week period, WHO's Europe director Hans Kluge told a news briefing.", "Preliminary findings from two South African clinical trials suggest the Omicron variant has a much higher rate of \"asymptomatic carriage\" than earlier variants, which could explain why it has spread so rapidly across the globe.", "The studies - one of which was carried out when Omicron infections were surging in South Africa last month and another which resampled participants around the same time - found a far greater number of people tested positive for the coronavirus but were not showing symptoms compared to previous trials.", "Cities across China are imposing tougher restrictions to try to control new outbreaks of COVID-19, with Tianjin battling the Omicron variant which was detected to have been transmitted locally in two other provinces.", "A Tianjin official told a Tuesday press briefing 49 domestically-transmitted cases with confirmed symptoms have been detected during the latest outbreak.", "Hong Kong will shut kindergartens and primary schools and start offering vaccines for children from the age of five, the city's leader said on Tuesday, as the financial hub grapples with an increase in infections.", "The country will maintain its tight entry restrictions to prevent the spread of the Omicron variant until the end of February, the Prime Minister said on Tuesday, though some exceptions for humanitarian reasons may be considered.", "Japan adopted some of the strictest border controls in the world when Omicron emerged late last year.", "Poland's total number of coronavirus-related deaths surpassed 100,000 on Tuesday, the health minister said, as the country struggles to convince people to get vaccinated despite persistently high infection rates.", "The number of deaths per one million inhabitants was last week among the highest in the world, according to the Our World in Data project at the University of Oxford, at more than 57 compared to around 34 in the US and 38 in Russia.", "Reuters / Newshub."]
